DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Specimen Review Parameter Object Histological Quality Text Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An aggregate of cells with similar or identical specialized characteristics, contributing to the performance of a specific function.  Tissues are parts of organs.  Representative examples include epithelium, lymphoid tissue, and connective tissue.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.:Any factor that defines a system and determines (or limits) its performance._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.:An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth._Text; the words of something written._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An aggregate of cells with similar or identical specialized characteristics, contributing to the performance of a specific function.  Tissues are parts of organs.  Representative examples include epithelium, lymphoid tissue, and connective tissue.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.:Any factor that defines a system and determines (or limits) its performance.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.
Any factor that defines a system and determines (or limits) its performance.
